column4: Can I chat with other users logged in to my box via the ssh shell?
write command
Make sure the files (and folders) are readable by the www-data user (this usually means everyone)
Folders being "readable" also means they need to be +x
Ah okay.  Let's give that a try.
Folders are 755 and chmod`ed +x. No results.
And the files?  (755 implies +x)
Yes. I'm receiving The requested URL /~mahoney was not found on this server. (with mahoney as the user) as the error.
I believe /home/mahony/ will also need to be o+x
is that 777?
no, 755 will work
Hmm. It already is.
Alright.  And /home/mahoney/public_html/ is too?
Correct.
Hmm, and `ls -l /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/ | grep userdir` outputs stuff?
nothing actually.
Ah, that'd be your problem then.  Do this: sudo a2enmod userdir && sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 force-reload
You didn't have the userdir module enabled (which is what handles the public_html stuff)
two separate commands right?
If you just copy that whole thing, the && will take care of it
wonderful
Perfect. Thank you very much!
glad to help.  You might be also interested in: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FilePermissions which will cover how to convert between numbers and letters and stuff
That`ll definately help. Thanks again.
